1:
Yahweh, do not forget King David\q2 and all the hardships he endured!
\q1
2:
He made a solemn promise to you,\q2 the mighty God whom our ancestor Jacob worshiped.


\q1
3:
He said, "I will not go home,\q1 I will not rest on my bed,
\q1
4: and I will not sleep at all\q1
5:
until I build a place for Yahweh,\q2 a home for the mighty God whom Jacob worshiped."



\q1
6:
In Ephrathah we heard where the sacred chest was.\q2 So we went and found it near the city of Kiriath Jearim, and we took it to Jerusalem.
\q1
7:
Later we said, "Let us go to the sacred tent of Yahweh in Jerusalem;\q2 let us worship there in front of the throne where he is sitting."
\q1
8:
Yahweh, come to the place where you live eternally,\q2 to the place where your sacred chest is,
\q2 to the place that shows that you are very powerful.


\q1
9:
I want that the righteous behavior of your priests will always be evident,\q1 and that your people will always shout joyfully.
\q1
10:
You chose David to serve you as king of Israel;\q2 do not reject him!



\q1
11:
Yahweh, you made a solemn promise to David,\q2 a promise that you will not break.
\q1 You said, "I will cause your descendants to rule as kings like you.
\q2
12:
If they obey my covenant with them\q2 and obey all the commands that I will give them,
\q1 the line of kings descended from you will never end."



\q1
13:
Yahweh has chosen Jerusalem;\q1 that is where he wants to rule from.
\q1
14:
He said, "This is the city where I will live forever;\q2 this is the place where I want to stay.


\q1
15:
I will give to the people of Jerusalem all that they need;\q2 I will give enough food to satisfy even the poor people there.
\q1
16:
I will cause the priests to behave in a manner worthy of ones whom I have saved;\q2 and all my people who live there will shout joyfully.



\q1
17:
There in Jerusalem I will cause one of David's descendants to become a great king;\q2 he also will be my chosen king,
\q1 It is there that I will make David's line of descendants continue.
\q1
18: I will defeat his enemies and cause them to be very ashamed;\q2 but the crown that my king wears will always shine."
